definition: dialect/language/spoken words/speech/talk/words/conversation/what sb said/CL:種|种[zhong3],席[xi2],句[ju4],口[kou3],番[fan1]

son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)

sentences.english: A few drinks will help to break the ice at the party.
sentences.chinese: 宴会上喝几杯酒，会有助于人们打开话匣子。

sentences.english: Frank talked away like a chatter box.
sentences.chinese: 弗兰克像个话匣子说个没完。

sentences.english: Wei Gong opened the chatterbox, casually about their research on Feng shui.
sentences.chinese: 魏公便打开了话匣子，随口讲起自己对风水的研究。

sentences.english: He couldn’t have lasted five minutes with a chatterbox.
sentences.chinese: 他受不了话匣子，最多能忍耐五分钟。

sentences.english: In front of the taxi drivers, I just firmly secured, chatterbox will be opened.
sentences.chinese: 眼前的这位出租车司机，我刚坐稳，话匣子便打开了。

sentences.english: He began speaking before Zanetta's buttocks had made contact with his chair.
sentences.chinese: 扎奈塔的屁股还没沾上座位，他就打开了话匣子。

sentences.english: She is a chatterbox who never shuts up.
sentences.chinese: 她一打开话匣子就停不了。

sentences.english: Following the oral literary tradition of Arab culture, she joined in.
sentences.chinese: 她遵循阿拉伯的口述传统，也打开话匣子。

sentences.english: A bottle of wine had loosened Jack's tongue.
sentences.chinese: 一瓶酒下肚，杰克的话匣子便翻开了。

sentences.english: And then your friend starts to open up just a little bit more.
sentences.chinese: 这时你的朋友打开了话匣子。

definition: unceasing torrent (idiom)/talking non-stop/gabbling forty to the dozen
erhua variant of 話茬|话茬[hua4 cha2]
to talk about this and that (idiom); to ramble incoherently
see 天南地北[tian1 nan2 di4 bei3]
(to express one's) true feelings/what is on one's mind/secret mind
distant places/all over the country/(to talk) about this and that
